result.execSummary:
The defendant Ross R Bukatz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. Reimbursement for Buy Money to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha County Sheriff Metro Drug Unit.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Provide DNA specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combination. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ross R Bukatz

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ross R Bukatz in court with Attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentence hearing.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Wales makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling

BUY MONEY:  $1,250.00 (to be paid to Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit, to be paid as a condition of probation)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:  60 DAYS, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ross R Bukatz in court with attorney Scott A. Wales.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Wales requests a plea/sentencing date in November. Court grants request.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Andrew S. listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Ross R Bukatz in court with attorney Scott A. Wales.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
  Hearing scheduled for October 3, 2014 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Ross R Bukatz
Current: 1300 E. Roberta Ave., Waukesha, WI 53186 United States  (Effective: 09-03-2014)
Prior: 1350 Royale Mile Rd #412, Oconomowoc, WI 53066
Defendant Ross R Bukatz not in court.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
